news.title: News
news.desc: As part of a European Union project, Evgeni Raychev, a representative of the University of Economics in Varna, Bulgaria, visited our university...
news.desc1: To celebrate the 35th anniversary of granting the Uzbek language the status of a state language, a spiritual and educational event was held under the slogan 'My Native Language - My Pride.'
news.desc2: A ceremony titled 'Dedication to Studentship' was held.
news.desc3: On October 2 of this year, a delegation from the Azerbaijan State Pedagogical University visited the Tashkent Institute of Economics and Pedagogy, led by the pro-rector for international relations, Dr. Mohira Nagi kizi Huseynova. A joint memorandum was signed between the two institutions.
news.desc4: Representatives from the Heydar Aliyev Azerbaijan Cultural Center visited our institute. A joint memorandum was signed.
news.desc5: A 'Student Evening' concert program was held in the dormitory of the Tashkent Institute of Economics and Pedagogy.
news.desc6: International Students Day was widely celebrated at the institute.
news.desc7: The Faculty of Economics won the Rector's Cup at the 'Cheerful and Resourceful' competition.
news.desc8: Samandar Burkhonov, a student of the Faculty of Social Sciences, won second place at the Uzbekistan Youth Championship in belt wrestling.
news.desc9: Muhammadrizoxon Umarov, a student of the Faculty of Economics, won first place in the Osh Open International Chess Tournament.
news.desc10: Marhabo Mirzarahimova, a first-year student of the Faculty of Social Sciences, won third place at the Belt Wrestling World Championship in Kazan, Russia.

aboutFaculty.title: About the Faculty
aboutFaculty.desc: The School of Computer Technologies (SCT), established in 1979, is the oldest department of the Eastern Mediterranean University. SCT provides high-tech education in a digital and multicultural environment to its multinational student profile. The language of instruction is English in the four-year Information Technology program (BS) and the master's program (MTech in IT). However, for two- and three-year course programs, the language of instruction is Turkish. With its excellent facilities and commitment to 'Project-Based Learning,' SCT offers the following educational directions: SCT has an International Student Advisor (ISA) to work with international students, assisting them with academic and non-academic issues. Additionally, Student-to-Student Counseling (S2S) services are provided by student assistants to help students with educational challenges. The main goal of the School of Computer Technologies (SCT) is to prepare highly qualified technical human resources required in the business, industrial, and service sectors of today's global digital world. To achieve this goal, SCT strives to equip its students with the necessary knowledge and skills in their fields through regularly updated project-based learning programs and experienced faculty members with industry expertise. The teaching language in the Information Technology program (BS) and the master's program in Information Technology (MTech in IT) is English, while in two- and three-year professional programs, it is Turkish.
